ygData.subject: RE: Special foraged foods
ygData.msgSnippet: I have a level 29 druid and she gets all sorts of weird foods (gets so many that she has to sell them since they take up so many different slots) and has been
ygData.messageBody:
I have a level 29 druid and she gets all sorts of weird foods (gets so
many that she has to sell them since they take up so many different
slots) and has been getting them ever since the patch. It took her
awhile though and definately for awhile I did not get them (i.e.
everyone shouting yahoo! I got a shroom and i had never gotten 1 at
all) now with my forage well over the master level I get them all the
time. I would say that its about in the 130's or so...i don't know
specifically but I get them all the time now along with the usual
foraged items. If you are not getting them as a bard I would say that
you may not get them. My bard has yet to get anything weird adn she is
wood elf..My suggestion is to yell out in the zone for them if you want
special foods...us rangers and druids end up getting rid of them as
there is just too wide a variety and we usually have an over abundance
of food. The other thought i have to add here is that like tracking
for druids...its a special skill. we get it at a level and it never
advances..it caps at 20 and when we get it that is the skill we get it
at. Is it possible that bards get forage and its at skill lvl 40 when
we get it. Just a thought... oh yeah and skill cap for druids is 200
i believe

Chisarra de'Danaan bard 8th song
Crysarra Windblade druid 29th season
> From: "Christine" <christine@...>
>
> I believe there is a skill-check involved in foraging the new special
> food
> (like crocodile eggs, mushrooms, sea salt, sylvian berries, glowing
> lich,
> etc), but I'm trying to figure out what it is.
>
> So I have a few questions:
>
> 1. Bards max at 40 foraging, right?
> 2. At what level do you usually reach 40 skill foraging?
> 3. Have any of you bards managed to forage something other than
> berries,
> fruit, rabbit meat, roots, veggies and water? And at what skill level
> did
> you get it?
>
> Anyone know about druids? (Like, if you have a druid, what is his
> skill cap
> and has he found any of the items, etc)
>
> Thanks!
>
> Daleia
>
> Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to
> toren@... with
> the subject lol.
>
>
